summary: This bill, the Medicare Dental, Vision, and Hearing Benefit Act of 2025, aims to amend Title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide Medicare coverage for dental, vision, and hearing care. It defines covered services, establishes payment structures with varying percentages based on the type of service and the year, and sets limitations (e.g., frequency of exams). The bill also addresses dentures, eyeglasses, contact lenses, low vision devices, and hearing aids, including payment rules and Secretarial authority for modifications. It further mandates the inclusion of an oral health professional on the United States Preventive Services Task Force.
